intro: Gynotroches puberula, commonly known as the hairy gynotroche, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes plants such as cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, inconspicuous flowers that typically bloom in the spring. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine pubescence, contributing to its common name. Gynotroches puberula is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
